alert.note: Alert for Skagit (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 26 at 3:28PM PST until December 28 at 12:10PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Skagit River Near Concrete affecting Skagit County. .The combination of ice and snow melt along with a series of wet weather systems passing through the area will result in river levels on the Skagit rising through this evening and early tonight. This will be enough to push levels above flood stage overnight and into Tuesday.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. WAC057-270730- /O.NEW.KSEW.FL.W.0079.221227T0543Z-221228T2010Z/ /CONW1.1.ER.221227T0543Z.221227T1200Z.221228T0809Z.NO/ 328 PM PST Mon Dec 26 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skagit River near Concrete. * WHEN...From this evening to early Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, the Skagit River will flood low areas and sections of roads along the river from Rockport downstream to Sedro Woolley. This level for this location on the Skagit corresponds to a Phase 3 flood in the Skagit County flood system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM PST Monday the stage was 25.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this evening to 28.4 feet. It will then fall slightly below flood stage tomorrow morning to 27.8 feet late tomorrow morning before rising above flood stage again early tomorrow afternoon to 28.3 feet. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
